intro: Arberella, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or golden flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Arberella has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural landscapes.
